About the job
Affordable Housing Compliance Specialist 

Edgewood Management Corporation is a 50+ year old premiere affordable property management company, providing superior real estate and property management for a portfolio of over 20,000 units in many states plus the District of Columbia. Edgewood’s portfolio represents a variety of multifamily products that include high-rise, mid-rise, garden and townhouse style rental units for all varieties of affordable programs as well as market rate/conventional properties. We have an exceptional track record to resolve problems and reposition troubled assets in all areas: operations, administrative, financial and physical. We are consistently ranked among the Top 100 Largest Managers of Affordable Housing by the National Affordable Housing Management Association (NAHMA), thanks to the outstanding leadership and talent in our company. Our reputation for providing high quality services with integrity has earned us the trust of our clients and our employees. We offer a supportive environment where employees are encouraged to develop their skills and talents to their fullest potential, and we are always looking for positive, motivated, and hardworking individuals to join our team.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities Include:

Reviewing household certifications for all affordable properties to ensure they're compliant 
Scheduling resident recertification interviews and apartment inspections
Coordinating on-site data collections and processing of resident information 
Maintaining property waiting list and resident files in accordance with our company’s policy & the regulatory agency’s policy
Ensuring proper calculation of income, assets, rent levels, etc. 
Training personnel on preparing income certifications and re-certifications for both Section 8 and Federally Assisted properties
Reviewing and approving of all move-in certifications, as well as quarterly review of annual re-certifications for Section 8 properties
Monitoring and report past due re-certifications
Assisting in generating all year-end building status reports for Section 8 properties and ensure all electronic reporting is completed each year
Monitoring correct usage of income and rent limits as well as utility allowances
Aiding office staff in several administrative and other tasks, including collection of rent, resident social activities and leasing tasks 
Perform all other duties assigned by the Assistant Manager/Community Manager

Job Requirements:

Minimum 2 years-experience in compliance of Affordable Housing (Section 8), Annual Re-certifications, Section 8 Compliance Regulations, and Leasing.
Strong knowledge of the IRS 8823 Guide as well as the HUD Manual 4350.3
Formal training and/or certification in related field preferred (COS or CPO)
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Capability to take charge and ownership of projects, self-starter and independent worker
Outstanding customer service orientation
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Knowledge of computer operating systems (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
One-Site knowledge is preferred 

The Ford Family Companies prides itself on offering a competitive salary and extensive, market-competitive health and welfare benefits including:

Medical, Dental & Vision 
Prescription Drug Program
Paid Vacation & Holiday
Paid Personal/ Sick Leave
Company Paid Life Insurance
Company Paid AD& D Insurance
Company Paid Short- Term 
Company Paid Long-term Disability
Supplemental Life Insurance
Dependent Supplemental Life Insurance
Educational Assistance
Financial Planning
Retirement Savings Plan with company matching 
Company outings and events

Edgewood Management Corporation provides superior management services for a variety of residential properties. We have an exceptional track record in systematically transforming troubled assets in all areas: operations, administrative, financial and physical. We have 51 years of premiere affordable property management experience and manage 27,000 units in fourteen states and the District of Columbia. We are recognized as the 9th largest manager of Affordable Housing by the National Affordable Housing Management Association and the 50th largest manager by the National Multi-Housing Council. Our portfolio represents a variety of multifamily products that include high-rise, mid-rise, garden and townhouse-style rental units.

Our reputation for providing high quality services with integrity has earned us the trust of our clients and our employees. We offer a supportive environment where employees are encouraged to develop their skills and talents to their fullest potential.

Edgewood is committed to a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are a growing company and are always looking for positive, motivated, and hardworking individuals who want to be part of a strong team focused on providing superior management services to our residents and owners. If you share our desire to be the best for our residents and communities, then you belong with Edgewood!

About the job
Our Company

7G Environmental Compliance Management (7G) is an environmental consulting firm headquartered in Tallahassee, Florida. Our goal is to simplify environmental compliance for our clients while creating a sustainable environment for generations to come. We value excellence, accountability, and integrity over everything.

7G partners with petroleum tank owners nationwide to mitigate the risk of petroleum release into the environment, while ensuring their facilities maintain compliance with state and federal regulations.

What you will do:

The person chosen for this position will complete a route of a certain number of inspections each month. The position requires working outside in all reasonable weather conditions. The chosen candidate may be away from home for more than five days at a time.

Conduct visual inspections of our clients’ petroleum storage tank systems and associate facilities.
Obtain required documents to ensure compliance with regulations.
Obtain knowledge with state UST and AST per Federal EPA regulations.
Gather and compiles the information into software platforms.
Follow a pre-determined route and complete visual inspections per the schedule.
Work outside in all weather conditions.
Respond promptly to customer needs.
Solicit customer feedback to improve service.
Respond to requests for service and assistance.
Gather and analyzes information skillfully.
Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness.
Observes safety and security procedures.
Report potentially unsafe conditions.
Uses equipment and materials properly.

 Physical Demands 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

You will frequently lift and move up to 50 pounds.
You will regularly be required to use your hands to touch, handle, or feel, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, talk, and hear.
You will frequently be required to stand, walk, sit, and smell.
You will occasionally be required to reach with your hands and arms.

What you need:

We understand you might not check all of the boxes but if you check most of them you might be the right fit! 

You will be required to obtain multiple state certifications within 30-90 days of employment. Company vehicle, iPad tablet, tools, and reimbursement for business expenses will be provided.

High school diploma or general education degree (GED); one to three months related experience and training, preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Proficiency in Apple/MAC devices, iOS operating system, and Google suite
Determination to uphold integrity at all times 
Valid driver’s license and driving history that allows insurability

What will set you apart:

Ability to excel in a fast-paced environment
Problem-solving skills
Effective communication
Ambition
Tenacity
Innovation

Why us?

We offer a wide array of benefits to include medical, dental, vision, disability coverage, life insurance coverage, 401k, paid time off and paid holidays. You will join our journey to make decisions today that will result in a sustainable world seven generations into the future. Our people are hard-working, inspiring and take pride in what they do. Our purpose is to have a role in a better tomorrow.

7G Environmental Compliance Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is the policy of 7G to comply with all laws regarding employment. We believe that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, genetics, veteran status, or sexual orientation. In compliance with the provisions of all federal and state civil rights laws, every effort will be made to employ and promote the most qualified individuals without regard to the above factors. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

About the job
Job Description
TITLE: Team Leader
DEPARTMENT: EIMC
REPORTS TO: Vice President of Engle Martin and Director of Technical Risk Management of EIMC
STATUS: Regular, full-time; exempt
PREPARED OR REVISED: May 2023
Summary Of Job Purpose
EIMC, an Engle Martin company, is an independent marine consulting services company providing supply chain loss control and claims investigation expertise to insurers, brokers, 3PLs and industrial partners. The Team Leader balances technical industry knowledge and people management experience, while being primarily responsible for leading, managing, and holding direct reports accountable for individual and team performance.
Primary Job Responsibilities
Learns, leverages, and develops team member strengths and skillsets with assigned work.
Proactively monitors and corrects performance through reviews and audits based on standardized metrics.
Embraces and applies the tenets of management training programs and corporate operating systems.
Contributes to the development and refinement of processes, procedures, reporting, data management, and workflow automation.
Assigns incoming workflow within the claim team based on client relationships and direct report skillsets.
Leads regularly scheduled meetings to mentor direct reports and resolve issues.
Monitors team’s productivity levels to accomplish established productions goals.
Maintains client relationships and attends local trade events.
Maintains a partial caseload of claim files.
Acts as a mentor and guides team members toward personal and professional development.
Monitors quality control through file audits and individual file reviews upon completion. 
Establishes and maintains positive working relationships with other members of the organization across departments, divisions, and locations.
Stays abreast of office and company policies, procedures, and practices; participates in ongoing training and development as assigned or approved to assure knowledge and skills remain current and comprehensive. 
Maintains the confidentiality of proprietary and sensitive information, exercising sound judgment and discretion in any disclosure of information related to EM, EIMC, and its endeavors.
Adheres to all applicable State Insurance Regulation requirements and other applicable laws, regulations, and standards.
Required Education & Experience
At least five years of experience in a marine claims management or property claims management role
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Desired Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Strong interpersonal and team building skills
Ability to remotely manager a team of direct reports
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Competency working with Microsoft office suite
Knowledge and prior experience working in Oracle Netsuite, or another enterprise software platform is preferred
WORKING CONDITIONS
Work is conducted primarily in a remote location or in an indoor office environment with protection from weather conditions and with exposure to noise typical of an office or administrative setting; though evening, overnight, and weekend travel may be occasionally required.
Physical Activities And Requirements
Work requires light lifting (10 – 20 lbs.), standing, walking, stooping, kneeling, reaching, fingering (keyboarding) and repetitive hand motion, grasping, talking, and hearing at normal speaking levels. Work requires visual acuity to read and prepare data and figures, type words and numbers, view information on a computer terminal, read, operate office machines, and determine the accuracy and thoroughness of work.

Title: Assistant Controller 
Ideal Candidate: The ideal candidate for this role will have a minimum of (7) years’ relevant current progressive experience, with a minimum of three (3) years management experience in a public accounting role. 
Schedule: 8:30 am - 5:00 pm, M-F. *This position is ONSITE in an office setting. 
Location: Gibbstown, NJ (08027) 

Position Overview

Reporting to Directorof Accounting, this position will manage all aspects of our financial reportingcycle, including preparation of financial statements and development,maintenance and refinement of financial reporting policies, practices andprocedures for the Company and its domestic and foreign subsidiaries.

The Assistant Controller willenhance the month-end internal financial reporting and utilize theirknowledge and further research and implement emerging technologies toimprove accuracy and timeliness of financial reporting. This position hasone direct report.

Essential Job Functions:

Manage the preparation of consolidated financial statements for the global organization, ensuring accuracy and adherence to accounting principles and reporting standards, 
Prepare internal management reports, and other financial documents. 
Lead the month-end and year-end closing processes, ensuring accuracy and timeliness. Conduct monthly performance financial analysis including variance analysis, trend analysis, and profitability assessments to provide financial business insights and potential areas of improvement to assist in decision-making processes. 
Perform necessary reconciliation (Balance Sheet, P&L) and analysis. Research balance sheet items and income/expense fluctuations utilizing various systems and information sources. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and foreign subsidiaries to streamline financial processes, identify opportunities for process automation, and enhance efficiency and accuracy to meet changing business needs. 
Participate in the development and implementation of financial systems to maintain accounting policies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness and ensuring consistency and adherence across different entities. 
Lead tax compliance activities and assist in preparing tax filings and related documentation (tax filing is outsourced to outside accountant). 
Stay up-to-date with changes in accounting standards, regulations, and industry best practices, and ensure their incorporation into global financial operations. 
Assist in managing compliance with regulatory requirements, improve and maintain effective internal financial control and risk management procedures to safeguard company assets. 
Play crucial role in implementing new financial reporting software, including ERP, CPM and Business Intelligence tools or upgrades for department improvement and efficiency. 
Collaborate with stakeholders and finance teams across different regions to facilitate knowledge sharing, best practices, and consistent financial practices. 
Assist in special projects and initiatives as assigned.

A minimum of seven (7) years’ relevant current progressive experience. 
A minimum of three (3) years management experience.

Strong attention to detail, demonstrated integrity and professionalism.

Proficiency with accounting research tools and techniques.

Adheres to always wearing the proper PPE/Safety equipment. 
Understands and complies with all written safety, health, and environmental procedures.

About the job
The ACS certification program is a mandatory program that serves as a performance management strategy to address the need for overarching consistency and Service-specificity of Military Family Readiness programs. The performance management strategy must assess elements of cost, quality, effectiveness, utilization, accessibility, and customer satisfaction.

Systems Navigators and ACS Compliance Specialists (SNACS) – ACS Compliance Specialists

Provide inspection and administrative support services at Army Community Services locations to support IMCOM HQ’s certification process, IAW the Department of Defense Instructions 1342.22, and Army Regulation 608-1. Support includes ongoing quality control related tasks outside of the scheduled site inspections. Certification support personnel will work remotely to the Installation Management Command (IMCOM) Headquarters (HQ), ACS Certification Teams to include the planning and coordination of inspections and site visits at ACS locations to support IMCOM HQ’s certification process.

Job Duties

Perform all required duties via telecommuting (telework) with the exception of on-site certification reviews conducted with the government. 
Administrative support includes ongoing quality control related tasks outside of the scheduled site inspections. 
At least once every four years the specialist will be responsible for participating in all certification inspection for ACS Centers, all ACS Programs, and Operations. 
Provide support virtually and/or onsite. 
Coordinate certification inspection milestones with IMCOM HQ, Certification Team, ID Functional Manager and ACS Directors at the Garrisons and schedule site visits with site points of contact at the sites to be inspected (Virtual and On-site).
Responsible for participating in all on-site certification inspections for no less than five (5) and up to fifteen (15) days on-site visit per years (this includes travel time). 
Be responsible for performing a variety of administrative support tasks to include issuing the inspection packet to the sites a year in advance, reviewing submitted materials, providing guidance as it pertains to the certification process, the completion of government provided checklists, entering data in Department of Defense (DOD) Family Programs Certification Management System (FP- CMS) tracking system, completing reports, and follow-up actions. 
Review ACS center’s pre-positioned documents to meet certification; prepare corrective action plans; review corrective actions for compliance; prepare certification correspondence and documentation; and obtain and review information from the DoD Family Program Certification Management System (FP-CMS). 
Plan and coordinate up to one approved training event per year to provide Army centric training for no less than nine (9) contractors per event. 

Required Skills/Qualifications

Ability to effectively communicate and interact with others, both in person and/or by telephone to conduct business.
Must be able to travel.
Experience with Microsoft Suite programs
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States. 
Must be able to pass a background check.

Required Education Level

Bachelor’s degree in a business or a behavior science field 
One year experience performing social science administrative work or social science inspections.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

As a federal government contractor, all employees will be required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 in compliance with DoD guidelines. All candidates applying for Patriot Enterprises LLC positions must attest to being able to meet this requirement to be considered for employment.

Job Description

Wanco is seeking a Quality Compliance Specialist with technical writing capabilities to support the creation, development, implementation and maintenance of an ISO 9001:2015 compliant Quality Management System (QMS).

The successful candidate MUST HAVE direct experience in:

 Writing QMS procedures for ALL elements of ISO 9001: 2015 standard
 Auditing all functional areas to the requirements of the standard, and or have audit or lead auditor certification. 
 Maintaining company wide compliance to ISO and other applicable standards. 

The role will work closely with department management to design, write and deploy applicable ISO 9001 QMS documents and ensure the ISO 9001 quality management standard is established and eventually upheld within the organization. The Quality Compliance Specialist will be responsible for identifying areas of concern and improvement in relation to ISO 9001:2015 compliance, technical writing and document control, conducting and documenting audits and associated CAPA and ensuring overall compliance with standard while moving the company towards ISO 9001:2015 certification.

Key Responsibilities:

 Help lead the development, implementation and maintenance of the ISO 9001 Quality Management System in the organization. 
 Conduct internal audits of processes and systems against the standard to determine their effectiveness and identify areas for improvement. 
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop action plans and provide recommendations for standardization within the departments. 
 Monitor the effectiveness of audit-response corrective action plans and verify that corrective actions have been effectively implemented. 
 Train employees on the requirements and principles of ISO 9001 to ensure compliance throughout the organization. 
 Assist in developing and maintaining an ISO 9001 compliant training program. 
 Prepare and maintain ISO 9001 documentation and records. 
 Manage ISO 9001 certification process and ensure it is maintained once certification is obtained. 
 Continually assess the effectiveness of the ISO 9001 QMS and suggest and implement improvements. 

Qualifications:

 At least 3 years of experience working within an ISO 9001 compliant quality management system. 
 Advanced knowledge of ISO 9001 quality management systems, quality control procedures and auditing principles. 
 Experience developing written processes and procedures within an ISO 9001 compliant Quality Management System
 Self-starter with a proactive approach to work efforts and problem solving. 
 Experienced in project management and planning. 
 Strong analytical skills and the ability to recommend solutions and implement improvements. 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with all levels of the organization. 
 Strong attention to detail. 
 Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously. Strong organizational skills are a must. 

Additional Attributes:

 Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business or related field preferred, or equivalent experience. 
 Process mapping experience preferred. 
 A career-minded individual looking to become an integral part of a growing organization and who is passionate about learning new things. 
 Experience in manufacturing or related industries. 
 Experience in implementing or operating a Quality Management System in a small business. 
 Certification as an ISO 9001 auditor, or other related certification, is highly desirable. 
 Experience with Lean manufacturing and continuous improvement principles (5S, Kanban, etc.)
 Experience working as an ISO 9001 (or other ISO standard) consultant or auditor. 

Physical Requirements:

About the job
“Republic Bank believes in the development and advancement of our associates. We offer the opportunity to learn all aspects of the company to prepare for future advancement. Come join our team for a career, not just a job!“ 

Grade 13

About Republic Bank

Republic Bank’s values are built upon making an IMPACT for our clients, our associates and the communities we serve. (IMPACT stands for Innovate for the Future, Make it Easy, Provide Exceptional Service, Acknowledge & Celebrate Success, Commit to Caring and Thrive Together) The associates of Republic Bank are the key to our success as an organization and we value our associates. It’s one of the reasons we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work in Kentucky for the last five years! For more information about the company, please visit www.republicbank.com.

Position Purpose And Objectives

The Compliance Officer leads the business unit oversight related to compliance with primary federal and state regulations and statutes for all products offered through RPG. In addition, this position will work closely with the Bank’s Compliance Department to ensure RPG is meeting the standards and expectations of the Bank’s Compliance Management System.

Minimum Qualifications

 Minimum 7 years’ compliance and/or legal experience in banking or fintech industry with consumer facing product management required.
 Knowledge and understanding of all necessary disclosures related to the Fair Credit Reporting Act (Regulation V), Truth in Lending Act (Regulation Z), Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA), Unfair, Deceptive, and Abusive Acts and Practices (UDAAP), Electronic Funds Transfer Act (Regulation E), and Truth in Savings Act (Regulation DD).
 Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager (CRCM) or management-approved equivalent preferred.
 Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office products.

Essential Job Functions And Responsibilities

 Develop policies, procedures, and training to ensure alignment and compliance with applicable regulatory requirements, federal and state laws, and regulations.
 Work closely with department management to obtain strategic goals in a compliant and efficient manner.
 Interface regularly with the Bank’s Compliance Department on initiatives with a regulatory impact.
 Develop and oversee the material review process to ensure appropriate regulatory review. This includes documentation of relevant information and regulatory analysis.
 Provide compliance feedback on new or enhancements of existing products and services.
 Engage with department associates and Compliance management on the strategy for adherence to laws, regulations, and guidance for new products, programs, or enhancement of existing products.
 Conduct regular meetings to discuss current processes, monitoring and review needs, regulatory updates, and/or emerging risks.
 As needed, recommend compliance training to associates and third parties.
 Provide support to associates in the analysis and resolution of issues or concerns to ensure appropriate and timely resolution.
 Collaborate with management on the implementation product updates driven by regulatory changes.
 Review new products and initiatives for compliance with applicable federal and state regulations, statutes, and guidance and provide advice to business holders and stakeholders.
 Develop and implement compliance related key performance indicators for products.
 Responsible for the review of testing and monitoring plans to ensure program encompasses and effectively monitors relevant regulatory risks. Provide recommendations on areas of changing expectations and emerging risks.
 Provide assistance in other areas when needed such as product and system testing and development.
 Monitor and analyze developing trends and changes in applicable laws and regulations, including credit and payments.
 Implement and execute appropriate risk assessment processes, in conjunction with the Bank’s enterprise-wide regulatory and other risk assessments.
 Report updates to management on issues to ensure awareness and to evaluate appropriate next steps for resolution.
 Responsible for adequate record maintenance and processes to document compliance efforts and risk decisions.
 Maintain a working knowledge of compliance requirements affecting your position and area of responsibilities and actively learn new regulations and assist in the implementation, if required.
 Model and foster behaviors that support the Bank’s values and corporate culture creating an atmosphere of trust, cooperation, accountability, and dedication to the organization.
 Willingly perform all other duties and projects as assigned.

Interpersonal Skills And Competencies Required

 Ability to work independently and exercise good judgment in the escalation of issues to RPG management.
 Ability to make decisions regarding compliance requirements and determine potential compliance implications for various situations.
 Must have a highly developed work ethic including self-motivation, time management, organizational, and detail orientation skills.
 Ability to manage multiple projects at once.
 Approach tasks with a sense of urgency and adhere to assigned deadlines.
 Effective communication (written and verbal) skills to adequately convey reports, findings, etc. related to job function.

Physical Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this position, the associate is regularly required to sit, use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The associate frequently is required to stand or walk. The associate is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The associate must occasionally lift and/or move 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, and distance vision. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Other Requirements

 Travel between Republic Banking facilities is required.
 Occasional out-of-town travel is required.
 Flexible work schedule that will include some evenings and weekends.
 Stay abreast of new developments, best practices, and statutory and regulatory changes.
The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this position. It is not construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements.

About the job
At Mercantile Bank, we are dedicated to our Customers, Employees and Communities. Our exceptional team members are committed to maintaining an environment of personal growth and development while providing professional and personalized service to customers and supporting our diverse communities.  Employees are our most valuable asset! If you have an interest in joining a team that operates with INTEGRITY and PURPOSE, consider Mercantile Bank as a potential employer.

Compliance Officer

Summary

Regulatory Compliance is responsible for developing and maintain a Compliance Management Program for the Bank that ensures compliance with laws and regulations, addresses associated risks of harm to consumers and customers and integrates consumer compliance into the day-to day responsibilities of management and employees. This position is responsible for assisting the Chief Compliance Officer with implementing various aspects of the Bank's Compliance Management Program. The Compliance Officer is responsible for providing guidance and direction with respect to compliance with laws and regulations with direction from management. This includes ongoing guidance and monitoring as well as the managing of implementation processes. The Compliance Officer works collaboratively with lines of business to understand current processes and to help each line of business adhere to regulatory requirements.

You would be eligible for a full benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, a flexible spending account (FSA), 4 weeks paid vacation, sick time, life insurance, a 401(k) with a match at 100% up to the first 5% of your contribution, discounted bank services, adoption assistance, exceptional training and development opportunities, and more!

JOB DUITIES

Possess working knowledge of consumer lending protection laws impacting financial institutions including TILA, RESPA, FCRA, ECOA, Flood, FHA and deposit regulations
Effectively communicates with various departments to provide responses to compliance questions as they relate to the various federal and state banking regulations.
Responsible for administering the Compliance Monitoring Program.

TITLE: Security Controls Assessor 

LOCATION: Tyson’s Corner, VA

CLEARANCE:  The Ability to Obtain and Maintain a TS SCI W/ Poly

What You’ll Get to Do!! 

The ideal candidate has experience evaluating and validating program and project Security Control Self-assessments of systems and architectures to discover, document, and report risks in support of Authorizing Official or designee (AO, D/AO) during risk-based decisions for the granting of Authorization to Operate (ATO).

Key Responsibilities
Review, detect, and document gaps and conflicting information within the Body of Evidence (BoE) presented during validation assessments by Programs and projects via demonstrated understanding of required content and ability to generate a range of security artifacts to include SAR, SSP, Automated Scan Tool Report, POA&M, etc.). 
Conduct architecture and system scanning to detect vulnerabilities and compliance with automated tools, and perform an analysis based on tool reports, to include false positive analysis and compensating controls.
In depth understanding of RMF, IV&V methodology and NIST 800 53 r4 and ability to perform within Telos Xacta implementation of RFM workflows.
Make recommendations to the IC CISO or designee for improving TTPS for better cyber threat protection.
Write final reports and defend all findings, including risk or vulnerability, mitigation strategies, and references.
Report vulnerabilities identified during security assessments.

Conduct security reviews, technical research and provided reporting to increase security defense mechanisms.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, And Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Information systems, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or a closely related discipline.
Four years of additional demonstrated work experience in Security Control Assessor (SCA) and Defensive Cyber Operations (DCO)Testing will be accepted in lieu of a bachelor’s degree.
A Master’s degree in an applicable discipline maybe substituted for three years of demonstrated work experience.
Three (3) years of cybersecurity experience with at least one year of experience conducting SCAs under ICD 503/CNSSI 1253 NIST Cybersecurity Framework, Risk Management Framework (RMF), or a similar framework.
One full year of SCA experiences within the last three calendar years.
One full year supporting cloud environment and experience performing security assessments in a cloud environment (AWS, Google, IBM, Azure, and Oracle).
Must meet Department of Defense (DOD) 8570.01-M baseline certification requirement for Information Assurances Technical (IAT) Level III CASP+CE, CCNP Security, CISA, or CISSP or Associate, GCED, GCIH, or CCSP.
Knowledge of Independent Verification & Validation (IV&V) of security controls.
Knowledge of general attack strategies (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK Framework).
Knowledge of NISPOM, ICD 503, NIST SP 800-53, ICD 705, and other ICDs as appropriate.
Skill in conducting vulnerability scans and recognizing vulnerability in security systems (e.g., Cloud Environments) ASW, Google, IBM, Azure, and Oracle.
Knowledge of system and application security threats and vulnerabilities.
Knowledge of network access, identity, and access management e.g., public key infrastructure (PKI).
Knowledge of network protocols such as Transition Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP), Dynamic Host Configuration, Domain Name System (DNS), and directory Services.
Ability to assess the robustness of security systems and designs.
Knowledge of cybersecurity principles and organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation).
Three years of experience performing security assessments in a cloud computing environment.
Strong writing skills.

About the job
The Job

Tango is seeking a talented individual for the position of Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering (BSA/AML) Officer to coordinate and oversee systems and controls that not only maintain our compliance, but also proactively prevent and detect illicit financial activity.

This VP-level role reports to our Chief Compliance Officer and leads a team of compliance professionals. The BSA/AML Officer will also provide expertise to advise and guide the company in the evaluation and development of effective compliance internal controls, program governance, and process improvements.

The rewards and payments space is constantly evolving, and you will lead cross-company efforts to design and implement innovative processes and solutions tailored for our industry, ensuring compliance with BSA/AML/OFAC regulations and maintaining a positive customer experience.

The successful candidate must have outstanding communication skills, an ability to anticipate and deliver on the needs of a fast-paced and innovative business, and the flexibility to simultaneously manage a wide range of projects.

Reports To: Chief Compliance Officer

As The BSA/AML Officer At Tango, You Will 
Oversee and monitor an effective BSA/AML compliance program that is aligned with current industry best practice, regulatory guidance and compliance practices.
Mentor and develop a team of Regulatory Compliance professionals, holding them accountable for analysis and consultation in a fast-paced environment that is continuing to grow and scale.
Provide subject matter expertise to the business in identifying, assessing, prioritizing and AML, Know Your Business (KYB) and payments compliance risk.
Establish, maintain and leverage relationships with other functional areas, to direct activities that promote an effective and synchronized approach BSA/AML compliance, such as:
Collaboration across multiple stakeholder organizations and senior leadership to ensure appropriate controls are designed and implemented within Tango’s products.
Collaboration with technology groups to apply innovative approaches to build cutting-edge transaction monitoring and KYB solutions.
Collaboration with revenue teams to assess risk of potentially higher-risk platforms prior to onboarding during the initial sales process.
Oversee examinations, internal audits, and external audits of the BSA/AML and OFAC programs; respond to exams and audit concerns and oversee corrective action of all related compliance deficiencies.
Establish, implement and supervise BSA/AML and OFAC compliance policies and training throughout the organization to ensure that the BSA/AML and OFAC programs are effective and efficient in identifying, preventing, detecting and correcting non-compliance with regulatory requirements.
Advise stakeholders of emerging risks, new or amended laws, regulations or agency guidance; recommend and implement changes and controls to mitigate risks, including those posed by any third-party relationships.
Prepare and provide regular updates and reports to CCO, senior leadership, authorized committees and working groups as appropriate.
Engage in relationships with key regulators to manage external requests, responding in a timely fashion, and ensuring coordination with internal stakeholders.
Manage an effective customer and vendor risk management program.
Ensure all required regulatory reporting is conducted in a timely, accurate, and compliant manner.
Oversee the company’s response to 314(b) requests and Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) 

To be effective in our BSA/AML Officer role, you must have:

Deep understanding of the financial services industry is required and must include experience in payments, gateway, e-money/wallet products and services, banking functions, money service businesses, or merchant processing.
Demonstrated ability to build and lead an effective, cohesive, and collaborative team.
Well-developed skills in leadership, influence management, business advocacy, communication and training; ability to think and act strategically and tactically.
Experienced in executive, board, and regulatory level reporting, in addition to managing regulatory expectations within financial services.
Strong focus and record of execution, with the ability to devise, own and drive compliance metrics.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to influence at all levels of the organization, while being able to simplify complex topics for understanding and critical decision making.
Ability to organize, prioritize, and lead multiple deliverables simultaneously.
Strong intellectual curiosity to expand and further develop an existing compliance toolkit.
Ability to balance compliance risk with business opportunities, with the agility to meet changing business needs.
15+ years of experience with global BSA/AML programs (BSA, KYC/CIP, OFAC, and USA Patriot Act within the financial services or fintech industry - including a minimum of 5 years as an AML Compliance Officer at a licensed money transmitter.
10+ years of experience in acquiring and payments processing (eCommerce, FinTech, banking preferred)
8+ years experience managing a team of BSA/AML professionals
Experience managing state regulatory examinations and working with state regulators.
Experience presenting BSA/AML metrics to executive level management.

Our ideal BSA/AML Officer at Tango will have most of the following skills and experience:

Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering certification (ACAMS)
Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager (CRCM)
Certified Fraud Examiner certification (CFE)
Experience with non-US customer due diligence
MBA / JD Degree

Job Description

Site Manager/ Director- Simply Biotech

Overview

Are you looking for a new career opportunity with an exciting biotech company?! Then we've got the right team for you! In this role, you're responsible for the duties listed below.

Immediate opening for a Site Manager/ Director, in San Diego, CA who possesses:

5-10 years of experience in the clinical trial industry, working directly with subjects
2+ years of experience managing direct reports in a clinical setting
Business development experience is a plus

Full Job Description: The Site Director is responsible for the profitable management of the clinical research business, consistent with company policies, principles, strategies, and objectives. Accountable for the overall coordination, organization, and efficient implementation of clinical trials management, operations, and regulatory compliance. Works closely with the Chief Medical Officer, Principal Investigators, Recruitment Team and Clinical Research Coordinators to evaluate clinical trials and ensure that all study-related procedures are completed properly from a clinical and a regulatory perspective.

The selected candidate will be responsible for:

Serving as supervisor and mentor to all direct reports as detailed by the organizational chart
Performing and/or overseeing all HR responsibilities for reporting staff including but not limited performance evaluations, corrective action plans, staff recognition, recruitment and onboarding of new employees, and management of staff schedules
Providing access and/or resources for all employees to complete the training needed to perform job responsibilities
Working closely with the Director of Operations, develops and implements business plans for achieving the strategic and tactical goals and objectives of the business
Maintain Standard Operating Procedures, working guidelines and associated training programs for the effective management of subject recruitment, appointment scheduling, informed consent, subject visits, source document preparation, timely Case Report Form and EDC completion and regulatory affairs
Ensures that all staff are adequately trained and adhere to Standard Operating Procedure and working guidelines
Participates in the weekly Business Development (BD) calls to review the site's pipeline for planning purposes and to provide feedback
Works with the BD team to complete feasibility, expedite protocol reviews and 'Go-No Go' decisions
Evaluates study protocols (e.g., with respect to enrollment/retention potential, site capacity and capabilities, and other determinants of success), with input from the Principal Investigator, Recruitment Manager and Clinical Research team, as necessary and contributes to decision as to which studies to pursue
Coordinates site visits and PI Meetings with the BD team and sponsoring organizations prior to study implementation and works with Clinical Research Staff to provide ongoing coordination of sponsor communications thereafter
Oversees the preparation and submission of regulatory materials to sponsors and oversight organizations
Coordinates approval of materials developed or modified at site by sponsoring or managing organization, as required
Coordinates approval of materials developed by site or sponsoring or managing organization by Institutional Review Boards (IRBs) and other outside regulatory organizations, as required
Ensures that studies are implemented in compliance with Good Clinical Practice (GCP) guidelines as promulgated by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and the International Conference on Harmonization (ICH)
Works closely with the VP of Quality to design and implement a Quality Assurance program for all research activities
Develops and maintains complete training files for all staff as outlined in the company's Standard Operating Procedures

The selected candidate will also possess:

B.A. or B.S. required; advanced degree preferred
Minimum of 3 years' experience in managing clinical trials. 
Understands regulatory requirements, as well as Good Clinical Practices (GCP), HIPAA and International Conference on Harmonization (ICH) guidelines. 
Certified in some aspect of research required
Able to communicate with providers, co-workers, sponsors, and others in a collaborative and courteous manner
Knowledgeable in medical terminology to communicate with physician offices, pharmacists and laboratory staff
Able to manage a staff of clinical professionals and create a productive, satisfying work environment
Demonstrates the initiative to act independently, initiating activity as required and making appropriate decisions within the constraints of study protocols, regulatory requirements, and company policy
Understands regulatory requirements, as well as Good Clinical Practices (GCP) and International Conference of Harmonization (ICH) guidelines. 
Excellent communication skills (interpersonal, written, verbal)
Ability to perform overnight business travel
Excellent Computer Skills to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint, as well as proprietary applications unique to the clinical research industry (such as Study Manager)

Salary Range: $90k-120k/yr

For immediate and confidential consideration, please email your resume to aencarnacion@simplybiotech.com or call 858.427.3668

More information can be found at www.simplybiotech.com

About the job
Interactive Brokers LLC, a subsidiary of Interactive Brokers Group, Inc. (Nasdaq: IBKR), is a direct access electronic broker serving professional and frequent traders, institutional investors, financial advisors, and introducing brokers.  For each of these topics, the Compliance Officer will be responsible for the following: 
 Crafting detailed written instructions for programmers and technical staff to enhance internal controls in response to new regulations or the launching of new business lines

Company Benefits & Perks

About the job

The Compliance Department provides service, support, and advice to promote the firm’s growth and development while helping employees and the firm meet their regulatory obligations, and more broadly, to preserve and enhance our reputation for integrity. This role will report into the Chief Compliance Officer’s (“CCO”) organization and assist with the day-to-day administration of the firm’s compliance program for its money service (“MSB”) and broker dealer (“BD”) businesses. The following duties are generally representative of the nature and level of work assigned and are not necessarily all inclusive.

Responsibilities:

Maintain and manage policies and procedures inventory, including ensuring regular and required reviews and approvals are completed in a timely manner.

Manage and maintain eToro’s Record Retention Policy and program

Identify and recommend necessary changes to business unit procedures to address compliance gaps or improve adherence to regulatory and firm requirements.

The successful candidate will ideally possess the following qualifications and attributes:

Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree a plus.

About the job
Job Details

Job Location

California Bakersfield UEI - Bakersfield, CA

Salary Range

$59,999.00 - $62,400.00 Salary/year

Job Category

Corporate

Description

International Education Corporation is the leader in post-secondary career education. Working at our employee-owned company is more than just a great career - its an investment in yourself. Our mission is to drive personal and community transformation by empowering students to make a positive and enduring life change. We are consistently searching for like-minded compassionate professionals who strive to be the best in their respective fields. Our top candidates share our commitment to helping students build the skills to create a future of which they can be proud.

We are currently seeking an Compliance Officer to join our team. This position is directly responsible for ensuring successful achievement of all campus outcomes relative to accreditation and state regulatory compliance, including accreditation readiness visits, placement confirmation and related functions. The successful Compliance Officer must know and understand all pertinent accreditation standards, state regulations, and state and local statutes and/or agency regulations at all campuses and is responsible for ensuring campus and corporate compliance therewith. The position must identify and work in concert with all functional areas to cure all areas of compliance vulnerability and risk, developing corrective action plans for resolution of problematic issues, providing general guidance on proper internal controls, and executing an effective compliance plan. The position reports to the Regional Director/Manager, Regulatory Compliance.

The Compliance Officer conducts the preparation and training for all campus functional areas for accreditor, state agency and programmatic oversight agency visits, including mock visits, updates, training, and regular audits. This position is responsible for the review and gathering of information and documentation for the preparation of applications, notices, and self-studies and the analysis and drafting of responses, requiring complex collaborating with both the field and the corporate management team. The Compliance Officer is directly responsible for the Companys internal quality control in the placement confirmation process and ensures the accuracy, completeness, and integrity of student outcomes (completion, graduation, retention, and placement) for all campuses, independently verifying that all data and processes are in compliance with company, state, accrediting, and federal standards. The position coordinates with Corporate Regulatory Compliance colleagues and the field to ensure compliance on all campuses.

Essential Job Duties And Responsibilities

Complies with applicable federal and state laws and regulations, accreditor standards, and institutional policies and procedures. 
Monitors, assesses, completes and is responsible for the submission of all state and accreditation deliverables on time and with a high degree of quality professionalism and accuracy. 
Must have thorough and complete knowledge of and is responsible for the dissemination of information regarding local, state, national, accreditation and regulatory requirements. 
Provides timely, accurate and complete management reporting for assigned areas of responsibility. 
Works collaboratively with campus leadership and staff and Corporate Regulatory Compliance colleagues to ensure all campuses meet compliance and regulatory requirements. 
Communicates regularly, professionally and effectively with all stakeholders at all times to achieve expected and planned results. 
Develops and maintains positive rapport with accreditation agencies and other applicable state/local regulators as directed. 
Assesses operational strengths and weaknesses and executes an effective accreditation and relevant state regulatory training program for assigned areas of responsibility, including appropriate introductory training for new associates and ongoing training for all colleagues and managers in the field. 
Holds frequent trainings and webinars with campus personnel to train and educate on accreditation and state regulations, standards and criteria. 
Gathers, reviews and maintains a complete and updated licensing/accreditation record for each program and campus and oversees the reconciliation of any approval issues and/or problems. Ensures official documents are submitted to Corporate Regulatory Compliance colleagues and retained in appropriate repository. 
Manages the preparation and submission of accurate communications and submissions to accreditors and state agencies. 
Assesses and identifies changes in applicable rules, regulations, standards and related trends that are relevant to maintaining accreditation and state licensing. 
Assesses and identifies necessary modifications to policies, procedures, and internal communications such as catalogs, websites, and marketing materials in conjunction with feedback from the corporate management team and the field. 
Obtains written verification (EVL) of graduate employment from employers based on accreditor-specific standards and company policy. 
Ensures the Companys internal quality control through independent verification of all self-employment documentation, waivers, drops-in-field, non-graduate completers and required documentation. 
Conducts an independent audit and verification function of placement documentation in student files to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and integrity of files. 
Updates, maintains, and reconciles outcomes reporting tools on a continual basis. 
Maintains professional appearance and demeanor for the management position and serves as a role model, leader and mentor to the campus community. 
Maintains independent continuing learning and education in all areas of compliance to ensure most up-to-date knowledge. 
Regular, reliable and predictable attendance at the assigned campus/office. 
Other projects as assigned. 

Qualifications

Excellent communication skills expressed in writing and in oral communication 
Experience in collaboration in managing projects with accuracy 
Possess advanced computer skills in word processing, spreadsheets, presentation software 
Be able to read, analyze, and interpret regulations, guidelines, and standards, as well as policies and procedures 
In-depth knowledge of accreditation and state rules & regulations 
Highly organized and goal oriented 
Ability to collaborate within all levels of the organization 

We offer an exciting, fast-paced and dynamic work environment. In addition, full-time colleagues have a variety of benefits available that include; Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Disability Coverage, a generously matched 401(k) plan, voluntary benefits and much more.

If changing students lives is also important to you, and you have the qualifications reflected above, we would love to hear from you!

Role: The Compliance Officer provides financial services of superior quality and convenience by ensuring the credit union remains in compliance with deposit, operation and lending laws and regulations and by proactively conducting regulatory compliance reviews. This position is responsible for implementing and administering the compliance program as the credit unions Compliance Officer. This position collaborates with internal and external auditors, examiners and regulatory agencies and acts as a resource on all compliance matters for credit union staff.

Essential Functions & Responsibilities:

Develop compliance reviews through interpreting compliance regulation requirements. Conduct compliance reviews in relation to established policies, procedures, regulations and internal practices to ensure organizational and employee compliance against regulations. Report to managers issues identified as operational in-efficiencies and or non-compliance and work with managers to create appropriate internal controls to correct. Collaborate with leaders regularly to ensure internal controls are functioning appropriately. 
Establish a system and maintain oversight of key control reports to ensure branch certifications and compliance reviews of internal policies, procedures and regulations are performed and findings are resolved promptly Escalate as needed to VP of Risk Management. 
Lead the compliance review of marketing materials to ensure the appropriate regulatory disclosures have been included and meet applicable legal requirements. Advise marketing personnel of appropriate disclosures for the various types of media. 
Independently review and conduct in-depth analysis on regulatory and legal changes or cases affecting financial institutions and determine their applicability and impact to CapEd. Lead projects required to implement regulatory and legal changes, including setting project goals, coordinating efforts between multiple departments, monitoring for effectiveness and writing disclosures and policies. 
Actively participates and provides advice and guidance with interdepartmental teams for continuous improvement of existing policies and procedures based on regulatory changes, internal audits and examinations by regulatory agencies. 
Interpret information from the Federal Credit Union Act, NCUA Regulations and all other banking regulations to be able serve as the trusted resource for the credit union, departments and employees in matters of compliance. Research regulatory/legal questions as they arise. 
Evaluate new products and services for compliance and necessary legal disclosures. Generate disclosures, policies and controls as needed to ensure that compliance is maintained. 
Implement and maintain the compliance training program and ensures that all personnel receive adequate training regarding regulatory matters. 
Backup BSA/Security Team including, but not limited to, CTR and SAR reports, BSA/AML activity review, check security equipment to ensure it is functioning properly, pulls security video as needed, and conducts security alarm testing. 
Assist the Risk Management Department with research by reviewing regulations, rules, and other compliance resources. 
Contributes to efficient Credit Union operations by performing other job-related duties as assigned. 
Maintains knowledge of all Credit Union products, services, and promotions. Provide excellent service to all members and internal clients.

About the job
Seneca Savings Bank is committed to serving our community and customers, which is our driving force inspiring innovation of new products and services. A healthy balance between technology and customer service, high empathy for our clients, employees and partners helps us stand apart from the ever-growing financial options for today’s consumers. No one else has the incredibly talented and customer-centric team of resourceful people that Seneca Savings has. Our leadership team collaborates well across all divisions.

Job Summary:

The Compliance Officer manages a comprehensive Compliance Audit Program monitoring all operational processes and procedures to ensure personnel are complying with appropriate banking consumer laws and regulations, as well as Board approved policies and procedures. This position provides appropriate training, support, and guidance as need is identified. And analyzes new and pending laws and regulations which directly affect the company’s practices to ensure compliance. Must possess knowledge of applicable federal and state consumer compliance regulations. Working onsite is required for an extended period of time while training and learning all about Seneca Savings. Hybrid work situation may be discussed after 6 months.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Assist in managing the Bank’s comprehensive compliance program including compliance with Community Reinvestment Act (CRA), Fair Lending, Right to Financial Privacy, Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA), Truth in Savings, Truth in Lending, Equal Credit Reporting Act, Flood Disaster Protection Act, Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act (RESPA) and Electronic Funds Transfer Act.
Perform compliance audits to determine whether established protocols are being followed and if/where they can be improved.
Remain current on state and federal banking laws. Evaluate new laws to determine their impact on Bank policy, procedures and/or practices.
Provide compliance guidance and regulatory updates to appropriate officers and functional areas when necessary. Monitor implementation of new laws and regulations.
Work with branch and department supervisors at the inception of new deposit or loan products/services to ensure Bank remains in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
Manage the annual assignment of training via the Bank’s on-line compliance training platform for all employees.
Act as the Bank’s liaison on regulatory compliance matters during federal, state, and other outside, compliance and CRA examinations.
Establish and maintain a central advertising file for record keeping purposes. Sign-off on any marketing and advertising collateral to ensure it is compliant.
Act as a back-up to our BSA Officer, working in tandem to accomplish all BSA, AML and bank compliance requirements.
Manage and help resolve, in a timely manner, customer complaints alleging discrimination and/or disparate treatment.
Review data and loan files to assist with Bank’s Fair Lending Program.
Review information regarding outside seminars, workshops, and conferences to provide recommendation to SVP- Compliance as to appropriate personnel for attendance, and to ensure own maintenance and expansion of knowledge through these outside sources.
Perform compliance reviews and report to the Audit Committee on the results as necessary.
Required to attend or participate in necessary compliance training, including but not limited to BSA, Security, Information Technology, OFAC, Privacy and applicable BVS courses.

Qualification Requirements:

 Three or more years’ experience with risk management, regulatory compliance, banking law and/or loan documentation.
 Bachelor of Science Degree or equivalent job experience
 Excellent attention to detail, analytical and communication skills
 General understanding of banking systems
 Working knowledge of federal and state banking regulations
 Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager (CRCM) designation preferred

Seneca Savings offers a competitive starting salary dependent upon experience and closeness to matching our requirements. Excellent benefits offered include: Health, dental, vision, group-term life, long-term disability insurance available with employer participation; PTO includes holiday, vacation and sick pay; 401K w/employer match; educational and employee assistance programs.

EQUAL OPPORTUNIY EMPLOYER/VETERAN/DISABILITY/DIVERSITY & INCLUSION

Job Type: Full-time, FLSA Exempt Schedule: Monday – Friday 8 am – 5 pm

To work in a family-friendly, team oriented environment where you are truly appreciated, apply today to join our team!

About the job
The Manager, Compliance & Quality Assurance, serves as a key subject matter expert and lead for DAOU’s federal and state regulatory activities in the areas of wine production, alcohol sales, distribution, and tasting room operations. This position is responsible for auditing wine activity and raw material data entry, tracking and tracing multi-tier wine lots from harvest to bottling, coordinating data entry corrections, and facilitating federal, state, and local report preparation.

Core Responsibilities

Records & Reporting

Prepare all federal and state regulatory reports accurately, on time, and in collaboration with third-party partners as applicable. 
Compose and maintain reports for annual production, wine lot gains and losses, ShipCompliant activities, and other statistical and analytical information, including reports about our compliance and quality assurance efforts. 
Oversee all federal, state, and local permit updates for all facilities, including changes at current sites, the addition of new sites, basic permit updates, letterhead applications, etc. 
File for all county fictitious business names when required. 
File for all TTB permit amendments like trade name additions and corporate officer or director changes. 
Apply for, maintain, and renew all licenses, registrations, and as needed to support operations of the company. 
Facilitate monthly California Winegrower’s, and semi-monthly TTB excise tax returns for all production facilities. 
Maintain all records and documentation in an organized, appropriate, and easily accessible way. 

Inspection, Review, & Audit

Assist with internal and external audits to ensure adherence to compliance and quality standards and regulations.
Assist as needed with the internal label approval process, COLA, and TTB submissions.
Perform daily and weekly wine lot data entry tracking and traceability; ensure software transactions are performed accurately and timely. 
Perform data entry audits by wine tiers to ensure accuracy and completeness. 
Develop, review, and recommend policies and practices to improve efficiencies and comply with local, state, and federal regulations pertaining to related areas of responsibility; recommend revisions to existing policies to ensure compliance with applicable laws. 
Collaborate with departments to ensure compliance needs and gaps are prioritized, identified, and addressed; advise internal stakeholders on regulatory and compliance matters. 
Perform other related duties as assigned. 

Regulations & Agency Coordination

Serve as key point of contact internally and with our third-party compliance partner to ensure the company complies with all regulatory requirements for all of the various company federal and state licenses. 
Engage with third-party consultants, service providers, and government agencies to resolve compliance issues as needed. 
Be well-versed and knowledgeable in federal and state regulations for wine and spirits. 
Stay abreast of upper acceptable quality limitations (AQLs) for all supply materials. 

Requirements

Must be at least 21 years old. 
Bachelor's degree in relevant field. 
Certification for quality control (such as ISO 9000) is a plus. 
1–2 years’ experience in the principles and practices of compliance, quality management, and quality assurance, preferably in the wine industry. 

Success Factors & Preferred Skills

Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, significant experience with QA and compliance methodologies and standards, and ability to create and evaluate data and statistical information. 
Ability to solve complex problems while managing changing priorities and issues. 
Exercise sound, independent judgment within established policy guidelines. 
Understanding, interpreting, and applying laws and regulations. 
Extraordinary interpersonal skills for establishing and maintaining positive and effective working relationships with agencies, department teams, and individuals. 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
Strong self-management skills, with the added ability to take initiative, multi-task, be innovative and work under pressure. 

Working Conditions

Regular working schedule to include weekdays, and some evenings. 
Long and irregular hours during peak seasons and special events or audits. 
Requires local travel to and from production locations and may require limited travel on an as needed basis for locations outside of local area. Local area is defined as no greater than 45 miles from Company headquarters.
Must be able to lift at least 45 lbs. 
Sitting for long periods of time (8 hours per day). 
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

Benefits

401K, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life.

About the job
Aristotle Exchange (AIEX) offers an exciting career opportunity that mixes politics, events, business, finance, and technology. We aim to be the world's largest political event exchange managing billions of trades in event contracts.

Everyone at Aristotle Exchange is focused on our vision to transform how individuals can predict event outcomes and make money at the same time through head over heart investing in outcomes of mainly political events. Aristotle Exchange expects to become the largest event market in the world. AIEX is registering with the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC).

Aristotle International is a 40-year-old company with a distinguished history in politics, software and data science. Aristotle provides software and market services to PredictIt which set the standard for political event trading on a legal market for US traders. Now with 8 years of success behind it, Aristotle Exchange is coming to life as a CFTC registered designated contract market. Aristotle Exchange has been built upon our proven ability to evolve, lead, and drive new ideas at every turn. Today, we're approximately 130 employees across the country with team members in the EU, Canada, and South America.

This role is DC-area based but allows for a hybrid or fully remote schedule. 

Reporting to the Chief Compliance Officer (CCO), the Compliance Analyst plays an important role in the day-to-day running of AIEX's compliance program. They are a second line of defense compliance activities, ensuring that all business activities and operations follow AIEX's Policies and Procedures, the Bank Secrecy Act, CFTC/NFA regulations, and other legal requirements.

The Compliance Analyst assists in the implementation, maintenance and administration of the compliance program. This includes conducting compliance testing and reporting, identifying compliance issues and gaps, maintaining compliance training programs, monitoring regulatory development in financial legislation, assisting with customer complaints, conducting tests on various areas of the business, and analyzing and reporting on the effectiveness of compliance policies and procedures.

This position interacts with business partners and other Aristotle staff to ensure AIEX complies with the various laws, rules, policies and ethical standards governing the event markets.

Specific Duties:
Reviewing policies and procedures to ensure compliance with various regulatory and legal requirements.
Ensure Compliance risks are appropriately identified and addressed.
Advising business on compliance with exchange rules and regulations.
Approving firm marketing and advertising material, including website copy and FAQs.
Oversight and management of customer complaint handling, including maintenance of internal complaint log.
Maintenance of internal Issues log, and gifts and entertainments registers.
Management and administration of all employee regulated online e-training.
Performing other Compliance-related responsibilities and ad-hoc projects as needed.

Requirements
Bachelor's Degree
2-4 years of relevant Compliance experience at a similar type and size financial firm.
Knowledge of CFTC/ NFA requirements.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as pragmatic decision making skills.
Highly driven and motivated, organized with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders.
Analytic, with attention to detail and an enquiring mind and investigative approach.
Knowledge of cryptocurrency requirements is a plus.
Able to independently manage timelines.

Benefits

All positions are Full-Time, with competitive compensation, medical benefits, paid vacation, 401k plan and stock options. Casual dress code and a non-corporate atmosphere make this a fun place to work and learn in a team environment. Please visit our website at www.aristotle.com.

About the job
Join the TrueCare family as our Corporate Compliance Officer and help us continue our Mission - To improve the health status of our diverse communities by providing quality healthcare that is comprehensive, affordable, and culturally sensitive.

This is an opportunity for an experienced and dynamic Corporate Compliance Officer. This plan is based upon the TrueCare corporate mission statement, strategic enterprise management areas, and guidelines set forth by the United States Department of Health and Human Services, HRSA, the Office of Inspector General (OIG,) and in accordance with the Office of Pharmacy Affairs and the HIPAA Privacy and Security Rule.

Some Of The Essential Functions Include

Oversee and manage the day-to-day operation of the TrueCare Corporate Compliance Plan.

Collaborate with other departments (e.g., Human Resources) to direct compliance issues to appropriate existing channels for investigation and resolution. 
Ensure alleged violations of rules, regulations, policies, procedures, and Code of Conduct by initiation of communication to appropriate stakeholders.

Computer proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

Compliance Officer Responsibilities:

 Continually improve Compliance Program for relevant entity by utilizing applicable regulations, risk management techniques, and business area knowledge to maintain and test relevant policies and procedures that comprise the compliance program. 
 Identify and react to changes in regulatory requirements impacting the broker/dealer. 
 Develop and maintain a broad knowledge and awareness of the investment industry and regulatory and/or policy changes with potential impact on compliance monitoring or reporting. 
 Find, interpret and implement directives and/or regulation that impact(s) the current compliance environment.

 Complete the annual review of the broker-dealer’s compliance.

About the job
The Compliance Officer/Violations Coordinator is responsible for executing scheduled visual inspections of the community to ensure that homeowners are following the requirements regarding maintaining the general appearance of their homes and surrounding property as indicated in the Declaration of Covenants of each Association. 

 

 

 

Inspections based on a cycle where by the community is divided into equal sections with one section being inspected each week.
Patrol the property regularly to determine compliance with the set of Covenants and Restrictions for the community. 
Works closely with the Security Department and Covenants Coordinator to determine best course of action for properties in violation. 
Establishes connections with property owners to encourage compliance and reiterate the Covenants and Restrictions of their subdivision. 
Communications with property owners in violation sin order to solicit voluntary compliance. 
Utilizes SmartWebs to send and track active violations within the community. 
Conduct monthly boat inspections in order to complete visual inspection of properties, if applicable.
Print and mail-out all violations notices on a weekly basis. 
Provide residents with the information necessary to correct the violation in a timely manner.
Attend Board meetings upon request to address violation appeals.
Report fines to Covenants Coordinator for disposition.
Assist in investigations, tape/log reviews for any unusual incidents.
Assist Community Association Manager with any special requests.
Resolves and follows-up on violation complaints/issues. 
May be assigned other duties by the on-site Community Association Manager.
Follows safety procedures and maintains a safe work environment.
As applicable, perform pedestrian or vehicle patrol of assigned area. 
Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills. Duties include the ability to communicate using clear and appropriate communication skills in formal and informal settings such as mediating disputes, advising of processes and rules, and enforcing policies and procedures while being polite but firm in all matters of communication. 
Maintain radio/telephone communications in a professional manner 
 

 

Education/Training/Certifications/Licenses:

High school diploma required. Associates degree with concentration in business preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience. 

 

Experience/Knowledge/Skills: 

Two (2) to Three  (3) years of related work experience. Strong working knowledge of customer service principles and practices. Excellent interpersonal, office management and communications skills.  Strong wrtting skills.

 

Computer literacy: 

Intermediate command of computer hardware/software is required; specifically, knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook.    Experience in maintaining a website is desired.

 

Language requirements:

Bilingual preferred but not necessary, depending on the community.

 

Travel and availability requirements:

May be required to travel for training sessions off-site on an ad-hoc basis.  May be occasionally required to cover for staff at other communities within a reasonable commuting distance when needed. 

 

Ability to work extended hours and weekends based on project requirement. Ability to respond to emergencies and callouts in a timely manner.

 

Physical Requirements: 

Ability to lift 30 lbs.,work in an upright standing or sitting position for long periods of time. Handle,  grasp and lift objects and packages. Reach with hands and arms. Communicate, receive and exchange ideas and information by means of the spoken and written word. Ability to quickly and easily navigate the property/building as required to meet the job functions. Complete all required forms. Must be able to operate a golf cart or other motor vehicle.

 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

 

Working Conditions:

Job Description & Specification

 JOB Title : Compliance Officer

NUMBER OF REPORTING POSITIONS: Nil
